calendar.description: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Hearing

general_provisions: This bill modifies the transient room tax and creates the Outdoor Recreation Mitigation Grant Program.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the acceptable uses of transient room tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a county to enter into an interlocal agreement with a municipality within the county to share county transient room tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>modifies reporting requirements on counties that impose transient room tax;<hr><ltbullet>provides that certain municipalities may appoint board members to a tourism tax advisory board;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state auditor to review a county's report on transient room tax and determine if the report is sufficient and compliant;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the maximum county tax rate on short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services for counties of the second, third, fourth, fifth, and sixth class;<hr><ltbullet>extends an earmark on certain transient room tax revenue for a county of the first class; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the state tax rate on short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services;<hr><ltbullet>imposes an additional state tax on short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services that take place within a county of the first class;<hr><ltbullet>directs the State Tax Commission to distribute certain revenue the state collects on short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services;<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset on the State Search and Rescue Advisory Board; <hr><ltbullet>creates a sunset review;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the uses of the Transient Room Tax Fund;<hr><ltbullet>establishes an outdoor recreation mitigation grant program within the Division of Outdoor Recreation;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Outdoor Recreation Mitigation Grant Fund;<hr><ltbullet>describes the criteria to apply for and receive an outdoor recreation mitigation grant;<hr><ltbullet>describes the acceptable uses of an outdoor recreation mitigation grant;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Outdoor Recreation to provide a written report annually to the Revenue and Taxation and Political Subdivisions Interim committees; <hr><ltbullet>repeals the sunset date on the Volunteer Emergency Medical Service Personnel Health Insurance Program; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
